ðŸ”¥ QualityScaler | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enhancing the resolution and visual quality of images and videos using AI-powered upscaling and denoising techniques.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Image and Video upscale â€¢ Multiple GPUs support â€¢ Compatible images and video formats â€¢ Automatic image tilling to avoid GPU VRAM limitation â€¢ Resize image/video before upscaling
ðŸ“– Summary: QualityScaler is a Windows application developed in Python that leverages AI to enhance the quality of images and videos. It focuses on upscaling, denoising, and reducing compression artifacts, making it suitable for improving the visual fidelity of various media types. The application supports multiple GPUs and offers a user-friendly GUI for image and video processing.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ strix | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Detect and validate critical vulnerabilities in applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Full hacker toolkit â€¢ Teams of agents that collaborate and scale â€¢ Real validation with PoCs â€¢ Developer-first CLI with actionable reports â€¢ Auto-fix & reporting
ðŸ“– Summary: Strix is an open-source AI-powered security tool that uses autonomous agents to find and validate vulnerabilities in applications. It aims to provide fast and accurate security testing by simulating real-world hackers, generating proof-of-concepts, and offering actionable reports for developers and security teams.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ oh-my-logo | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating ASCII art logos with gradient colors for terminal display and project branding.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Two Rendering Modes (outlined ASCII art or filled block characters) â€¢ 13 Beautiful Palettes â€¢ Gradient Directions (vertical, horizontal, and diagonal) â€¢ Multi-line Support â€¢ Zero Dependencies (npx usage)
ðŸ“– Summary: oh-my-logo is a TypeScript-based tool for generating visually appealing ASCII art logos with gradient colors in the terminal. It offers features like customizable rendering modes, color palettes, gradient directions, and multi-line support, making it suitable for project banners, startup logos, and terminal customization.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ fireplexity | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI-powered search engine with real-time data and citations.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI search engine â€¢ Web search â€¢ News search â€¢ Image search â€¢ Real-time citations
ðŸ“– Summary: Fireplexity v2 is an open-source AI search engine that aims to replicate the functionality of Perplexity AI. It supports searching the web, news, and images, providing real-time citations and streaming responses, leveraging Firecrawl for live data.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ lazyeat | Vue
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Touch-free device control during meals or when hands are dirty.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Hands-free control via gesture recognition â€¢ Voice input support â€¢ Cross-platform compatibility (Windows, macOS, Linux) â€¢ Intuitive gesture control (swiping, clicking) â€¢ Integration with video playback (pause, full screen, switch videos)
ðŸ“– Summary: Lazyeat is a touch-free controller application that utilizes gesture recognition and voice input to allow users to interact with their devices without physical contact. It is designed to be used while eating, preventing greasy hands from touching devices when watching videos or browsing the web.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ pinstr | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Curating and sharing interests with others in a decentralized social network.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Decentralized backend with Nostr protocol â€¢ Open-source and free to use â€¢ Create customized public boards of pins on almost any topic â€¢ Like, Comment, and Zap other users' boards â€¢ Easy-to-use interface
ðŸ“– Summary: Pinstr is a decentralized, open-source social network built on the Nostr protocol. It allows users to curate and share their interests by creating and sharing boards of pins, similar to Pinterest but with a decentralized backend. Users can also engage with each other by liking, commenting, and zapping boards.
